alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong storms will impact portions of Volusia, eastern Seminole and Orange, and northwest Brevard Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 257 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from DeLand Airport to Geneva to Belle Isle. The storms were moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Deltona, Daytona Beach, Port Orange and Sanford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
